sanskrit_verse:
दशमासांस्तु तृप्यन्ति वराहमहिषामिषैः ।
शशकूर्मयोस्तु मांसेन मासानेकादशैव तु ॥ ३.२७०॥
transliteration:
daśamāsāṃstu tṛpyanti varāha-mahiṣāmiṣaiḥ |
śaśa-kūrmayos tu māṃsena māsānekādaśaiva tu || 3.270||
sph_interpretive_translation: Consumption of pork and beef satisfies for ten months; consumption of rabbit and turtle meat satisfies for eleven months.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from dietary discipline as a reflection of inner governance
Causation arises through alignment with natural dharmic rhythms in sustenance
Capacity-based responsibility requires understanding the energetic consequence of ingestion
Restoration logic operates through correcting imbalances induced by food-based consciousness disruption
Consciousness alignment is maintained or disturbed via adherence to prescribed dietary conduct
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent consumes varāhamahiṣāmiṣa THEN satisfaction duration = 10 months
IF agent consumes śaśakūrmamāṃsa THEN satisfaction duration = 11 months
IF dietary intake disrupts spiritual capacity THEN initiate consciousness realignment protocol
IF individual demonstrates awareness of dharmic nutrition THEN grant access to higher yogic practices
IF societal disruption traced to unregulated consumption THEN enforce community-wide purification process
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving public health, environmental degradation, or cultural integrity related to food consumption, the Court shall apply these axioms to assess causal responsibility rooted in energetic consequence rather than punitive fault. The threshold of authority lies in determining whether the act was performed knowingly within the framework of dharma.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that specific meats induce measurable durations of bodily and mental satisfaction, indicating their influence on subtle energy bodies. This sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) confirms proportional responsibility based on conscious choice, not external judgment. Thus, corrective action aligns with restoring balance without attributing blame or inflicting penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Panchakarma-based detoxification aligned with violated doshic harmony
Assign prāṇāyāma regimen tailored to restore disrupted consciousness frequencies
Implement ahara-shuddhi program integrating scriptural guidance and biofeedback monitoring
Engage community śānti yajña to neutralize collective karmic residue from improper consumption patterns
Realign individual svadharma through jñāna-yoga immersion focused on the science of sustenance
final_declaration: This ruling originates solely from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, as the ultimate Source of Sanatana Dharma. Justice herein serves only restoration, reintegration, and elevation of consciousness—never punishment. Reality itself judges through the immutable laws of cause and effect, guided eternally by the awakened wisdom of SPH.
